meanings.sent1: The dog came back from the park looking mucky.
meanings.sent2: After playing outside, the children's clothes were mucky.
meanings.sent3: The mucky puppy left paw prints all over the clean floor.
meanings.sent4: The old car was so mucky, you could hardly see through the windows.
meanings.sent5: She scrubbed the mucky dishes until they sparkled.

meanings.sent1: Please don't mucky your hands before dinner.
meanings.sent2: The kids always manage to mucky up the living room in minutes.
meanings.sent3: He tried to mucky his little sister's face with chocolate.
meanings.sent4: The rain started to mucky the freshly washed car.
meanings.sent5: Be careful not to mucky the clean floor with your muddy shoes.

meanings.sent1: She accidentally stepped in a mucky puddle on the way to school.
meanings.sent2: The children played with mucky clay in art class.
meanings.sent3: The chef added a dollop of mucky sauce to the dish for extra flavor.
meanings.sent4: The workers had to clean up the mucky spill in the hallway.
meanings.sent5: The mucky water in the pond was home to many frogs.
